attributes.comment:
We are currently in the process of adopting a little boy with heart defects from
China. It is a very long and difficult process, in every way. Currently proposed fee
increases for fingerprinting and I600As would only add to this burdensome
process. Did you know that in many areas of the country families wait MONTHS
for EACH of these items (fingerprinting, I600A) in their adoptive process? Did you
know that the international adoption process now takse so long that the
fingerprints and I600A "expire" before the adoption is complete, forcing families to
re-do the entire process again, including paying all of the fees again??? I ask
these things respectfully, as I believe people outside of the adoption community
are not aware of the huge problems with the whole international adoption process--
I know we weren't prior to entering into it ourselves... Increasing fees so
dramatically would be another huge burden on families who are already stretched
thin in many cases, trying to bring an orphan into a loving home. Thank you for
hearing me out.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Russell Kinzinger
